text: Nicola Quarta (23 September 1927 â€“ 27 June 2020) was an Italian politician. Quarta was born in Campi Salentina, Italy. and later served as its mayor for two terms. Quarta was a member of the Christian Democracy. He was a prefect until 1970, when he left office to run for the newly created Apulia regional council. Quarta was President of Apulia between 1978 and 1983. He was a member of the Chamber of Deputies until 1992. Quarta retired from politics in 1995. Quarta died on 27 June 2020, aged 92. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Politicians from Apulia
title: Nicola Quarta
